message: Its Freshout Ya! Record it now can generate the gif from the video :-)
story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Recordit: Record screencasts fast & free! with GIF Support!
caption: recordit.co

data.message: Looks great! You guys doing objc?

I don't. My role on this project was the UI Only. but yes we have people who do Objective C, Mobile apps iPhone (https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mideast-tunes/id366646745?mt=8) /Android (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.freshout.v2.mideastunes&hl=en) as well
Hady Ahmed wanna know the features of placeit and Recordit: http://cl.ly/43153J0e2R22 BTW I wrote the Lyrics :)
Emad Elsaid give our app a try and let me know what do you think :)
oh, that's yours ? definitely i'll do.
i have a small comment, when it uploads could it show the percentage in the icon itself ? that would be great, also the option to store to desktop instead of web will be great.
also CMD+Dragging the try icon should remove it from the action bar, as this is the standard behaviour i believe?
i think i have a very bad internet connection, but why did it give me too many notifications instead of 1 ? to be precise it is 12 notification.
The CMD+Drag is not that urgent. but let me show you something cool!
website design is very simple, thats what i like it, the app is also simple straight forward that i managed to use it without trying any stupid things.
you can generate a gif of your video :)

Yes for app development the design is irrelevant (don't tell anybody it's a secret) just focus on the actual functionality of the App it self. people don't care if your site is horrible, broken or anything. they only care that the app they downloaded work.
yup, :D i use the other app for this only (gif), for screencasting i use quicktime, i'll use recordit if there is outputting as GIF to my local HDD directly without uploading to the web.

Cool stuff man, best of luck. Regarding objc, I was actually referring to the project itself :D was just wondering about the stack you guys are using. Specifically  for the desktop app, but any info about the server stack wont harm either :D
That piece was dope! Nice work with the lyrics, who's the rapper?

yeah for the desktop it's Objective C and Socket.io :)  and for the web stack we have made our own stack of libraries for development, testing and errors reporting all based on  javascript client side and server side :)
